title: Cauvery Aarti: A River,
description:
K M Manisha Our day begins with water and ends with water.
Water is our dharma our duty, our faith, our life.
And at the heart of this eternal flow stands the Cauvery not just a river, but a mother, a lifeline, and a symbol of Karnatakas spirit. For centuries, she has nurtured our soil, sustained our people, and shaped our civilization.
On September 26th, 2025, under the glowing skies of Brindavan Gardens, KRS Dam, Mandya, a dream long held in the hearts of millions finally took form the Cauvery Aarti.
A Vision That Flowed into Reality What the Ganga Aarti is to the North, the Cauvery Aarti has now become to the South a spiritual spectacle that celebrates the unity of divinity, culture, and nature.
For the first time in South India, this majestic ritual has found its home on the sacred banks of the Cauvery, made possible through the vision and leadership of Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar, and with the tireless efforts of BWSSB and CNNL.
Behind this monumental event lay months of meticulous planning, consultations, and coordination every detail crafted to honour the sanctity of the river while embracing Karnatakas cultural soul.
A Grand Union of Faith and Culture The inaugural evening of the Cauvery Aarti was nothing short of divine theatre The river illuminated by a thousand lamps. The air resonating with chants, music, and devotion. Priests from both the North and South performing rituals in unison.
It was more than an event; it was a message a reminder that while rivers may flow through different states, their spirit belongs to all.
This Aarti brought together cultures, faiths, and people united by reverence for Thaayi Cauvery.
From a Moment to a Movement This years historic Mysuru Dasara was elevated to a whole new dimension of devotion and pride with the week-long Cauvery Aarti held from September 26th to 31st.
What began as a single, symbolic ceremony has now become a continuing legacy. The Cauvery Aarti at KRS, Mandya will now be held every Friday to Sunday, turning faith into livelihood creating opportunities for local priests, artisans, and communities who will sustain this spiritual tradition.
A Salute to the Lifeline of Karnataka The Cauvery Aarti is not just a ritual. It is a reflection of Karnatakas gratitude to its lifeline, of a leaders vision to preserve culture with development, and of a peoples bond with the river that gives them life.
As the lamps shimmer on the water and chants fill the night sky, one truth shines brighter than ever.
Cauvery is not just a river we worship. She is the rhythm that flows within us.
Let us come together in devotion and gratitude to our Cauvery. honour our rivers, we honour life itself Under the dynamic leadership of Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, Karnataka has taken bold strides to combat youth unemployment through innovative programs like Yuva Nidhi and Yuva Nidhi Plus. Providing financial aid, skill training, and direct job opportunities, the government has empowered lakhs of young graduates and diploma holders across the state. With over 3.7 lakh beneficiaries, 179,000 job seekers engaged, and 1,500 crore allocated, this initiative marks a transformative shift from welfare to empowerment. Backed by measurable results and sustained commitment, Karnataka is emerging as a model state for youth employment and skill development.
author: A Reverence, A Revival
